comments.content:
Shoud be a "review request" issue, but seems that I cannot create one since
it needs a valid branch path.

Purpose of code changes:
To be able to use Closure Compiler in Ant. Can also be used in other
systems like Gradle, Buildr and Maven. It's not feature complete, but it's
a start. 

Added a svn patch that includes two java files. Also you need to have
ant.jar (1.7.1 but works with older) into the lib directory to compile.

An example build.xml script is included.

Cool!

So before we start, there's one bit of legal stuff we need to do. We need you to sign a 
contributor license agreement. This agreement basically says "I own the copyright on 
this code, and it's ok if closure compiler uses it".

http://code.google.com/legal/individual-cla-v1.0.html

You can fill it out online or by mail. Please let me know if anything on that page is 
unclear, or if you have any questions about it.

Actually I filled it out using srs@x3m.com (not stenrs@gmail.com) mail address. Hope
that's ok.

Ah, that's why I couldn't find it at first. That's a good question, and I'm curious 
about the answer. I'm trying to find a lawyer to ask.

Also, I misspoke earlier. There's a second form. If your employer has rights to the 
work you do, then you need to sign a corporate CLA.
http://code.google.com/legal/corporate-cla-v1.0.html
If you have any doubts about whether or not you need to fill that one out, you should 
ask your employer.

OK, I checked. It's ok if you used the email address at x3m.com in the form. checking 
if you need to do the corporate cla too is the only legal detail left.

Robert has agreed to review this. We'll do the code review in Rietveld. I have not 
used Rietveld before, but I hear that it is very good. I can take care of the 
bookkeeping. It's late in Brooklyn (where I live), and I have to go for the weekend, 
so i'll set that up on Monday.

what's the best way to have automated tests for ant tasks? We could just use the 
sample build.xml you wrote, but I wasn't sure if Ant had some other way to test them.

Thanks so much for contributing this!

No need for a corporate CLA. It's just in my spare time and my employeer has nothing
to do with this. 

I have written unit tests for Ant tasks before so can attach a simple unit test for
this in the beginning of the week.

Have a good weekend!

OK, I put the code review up at
http://codereview.appspot.com/184047
I haven't figured out how to test it yet, but am willing to take patches and/or 
suggestions on how to do that.

So far, I just put the Apache License on it and reformatted to match the style in the 
rest of the codebase.
Should be in as of revision 65.
